JUDGES: Angelika Nußberger;Dean Spielmann;Elisabet Fura;Ganna Yudkivska;Isabelle Berro-Lefèvre
TEXT: The applicant , Mr PERSON , is a NORP national who was born in DATE and is currently serving a sentence in GPE no . CARDINAL ORG , GPE .
According to the applicant , in DATE he was held for DATE in an unheated van , beaten in detention , forced to participate in court hearings while sick , and kept handcuffed during court hearings .

On DATE the ORG , in the presence of CARDINAL advocates , PERSON . and PERSON , sentenced the applicant and CARDINAL others to various terms of imprisonment for drug trafficking . In his appeal the applicant indicated that he had been “ prevented from hiring a lawyer , who would have defended him properly , and had no opportunity to consult a lawyer during the breaks in the hearing ” .
On DATE ORG , in the presence of advocate PERSON . and in the applicant ’s presence , upheld this decision . The applicant appealed in cassation .
On DATE ORG of GPE , following the applicant ’s complaints , returned the applicant ’s case file to the first - instance court because the applicant wanted to study the case file materials .

In additional cassation appeals lodged on DATE and CARDINAL DATE the applicant submitted that the first - instance court had ignored his requests lodged DATE to have the opportunity to consult a lawyer . He further submitted that the first instance court ignored his complaints about pages missing from his appeal case - file .

Before this ORG the applicant explained that while studying case - file materials he had discovered that , according to him , the first - instance court judge had removed CARDINAL pages from his appeal and that was the reason why he had wanted to meet with the lawyer . According to the applicant , the removed pages contained CARDINAL requests addressed to the court of appeal and the applicant ’s complaint to a prosecutor . The applicant did not specify either before ORG of GPE , or before this ORG what were the subjects of his requests and complaints .
On DATE ORG examined his appeal and found it unsubstantiated .
